text: Abu al-Futuh al-Razi (), full name Abū al-Futūḥ al-Ḥusayn ibn ʿAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Khuzāʿī al-Rāzī al-Nīsābūrī () or Abu al-Futuh Jamal al- Din al-Razi al-Nisaburi (), also known as Khaza'i Nishaburi (fl. 12th century), was a Persian theologian and author. He came from an Arab family originally from Nishapur. His grandfather had moved to Rayy, where he taught and later died in or after 1131. His famous work is Rawz al-jinan wa ruh al- jinan, the first Persian-language exegesis on the Quran. ==References== Category:Quranic exegesis scholars Category:1131 deaths Category:Iranian Arab people Category:People from Rey, Iran Category:Medieval Persian writers
